page.title: 07Stubble Burning Collingb'rne
page.content: Some of the farmers in Collingbourne Kinston area are using a Straw Chopper in preference to stubble burning. This chops the straw after it has been combined so it can then be ploughed into the ground. The new regulations concerning stubble burning and the public concern about damaging the natural habitat of the wildlife are encouraging the farmers to use other methods of disposing of straw. A large amount of straw is used in baling large and small bales which will be used for winter bedding and feed but a certain amount is always surplus to requirements. Illegal stubble burning can lead to prosecution and the farmer may be fined up to Â£1,000.
